page_content:
Portfolio of Approved Medicines
• ADCETRIS forms the core of our business and is now a U.S. standard of 
care treatment in frontline Hodgkin lymphoma and certain T-cell 
lymphomas. More than a decade after its initial launch, ADCETRIS has 
been approved in over 75 countries under our partnership with Takeda. 
• PADCEV is a first-in-class ADC that has become a U.S. standard of 
care for previously treated metastatic bladder and urinary tract 
cancers. Seagen and our partner Astellas have secured approvals for 
PADCEV in nearly 40 countries, including the U.S., Canada, Japan, 
and the E.U., among other territories, with additional marketing 
applications planned or under review. Furthermore, a supplemental 
application is likely to be submitted in late 2022 in the U.S. under the 
FDA’s accelerated approval program for PADCEV use in combination 
with prembrolizumab for patients with previously untreated 
metastatic urothelial cancer. 
• TUKYSA is a HER2 tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI) with broad potential 
in HER2-expressing solid tumor cancers. TUKYSA has been approved 
in 36 countries based on these results. In addition, a regulatory 
submission has been filed in the U.S. under the FDA’s accelerated 
approval program for TUKYSA’s use in combination with trastuzumab 
in patients with previously treated colorectal cancer. 
• TIVDAK is an ADC used to treat recurrent advanced cervical cancer 
and is an important new medicine for a disease that has historically 
been treated with drugs that result in low objective response rates 
and poor outcomes. TIVDAK’s clinical development program is 
designed to support global regulatory applications and maximize its 
future potential in treating cervical cancer and other solid tumors. 
TIVDAK was granted accelerated approval in the U.S., and continued 
approval may be contingent upon verification and description of 
clinical benefit in confirmatory trials.
Collective of Seagen products; ADCETRIS®, PADCEV®, TUKYSA®, TIVDAK®
Matt Bercow, Research Associate III, Pharmaceutical SciencesAs we expand our operations globally, we seek to commercialize 
our products directly or through commercial partnerships. We 
deploy our internal research, clinical, development, regulatory, 
and manufacturing expertise to expand our deep pipeline of drug 
candidates and seek new product approvals. We conduct internal 
research to support ADC innovation and supplement these 
internal efforts by acquiring or in-licensing products, product 
candidates, and third party technologies from biotechnology and 
pharmaceutical companies and academic institutions.
